00001 <?php
00002 
00003 ns::import('hygia.libs.validator.Validator');
00004 ns::import('hygia.libs.io.Response');
00005 ns::import('hygia.libs.exception.ValidatorException');
00006 
00012 class ValidatorRe extends Validator implements IValidator {
00013 
00014     private $sValidator;
00015     private $aValidationErrors;
00016 
00017     public function __construct($sValidator) {
00018         // TODO: known issue: chars like & and how to match (htmlentities/html_entity_decode)
00019         $this->sValidator = $sValidator;
00020         $this->aValidationErrors = array();
00021     }
00022 
00030     public function run(Response $oResponse) {
00031 
00032         if (!$oResponse instanceof Response) {
00033             throw new ValidatorException('Response is not of type Response');
00034         }
00035 
00036         // invalid when no validator is defined
00037         if (empty($this->sValidator)) {
00038             return false;
00039         }
00040 
00041         // run the regular expression on the body of the response
00042         $bValid = preg_match($this->sValidator, $oResponse->getBody());
00043         if (!$bValid) {
00044             $this->aValidationErrors[] = 'Regular Expression validator failed: <tt>' . $this->sValidator . '</tt>';
00045         }
00046         return $bValid;
00047     }
00048 
00054     public function getValidationErrors() {
00055         return $this->aValidationErrors;
00056     }
00057 
00058 }
00059 
00060 ?>
